json.text: "For the night is dark and full of terrors."
No, not for me.With this upgrade I can activate my night vision by pressing the "DM&R: Toggle Night Vision"-button (Default "o").
Dragon Magic Points per level: 2
Walk on Lava (temporarily deactivated), Run faster, jump higher and climb mountains without lifting your knee.
Dragon Magic Points per level: 6
Putting this glyph on my armor will allow me to take to the skies. Each additional level increases my speed. However, to overcome gravity, I need a small amount of mana.
The effect is disabled by the "DM&R: Toggle Flight" key (or "Disabled DM&R Fly" effect).
Dragon Magic Points per level: 7
With this rune, running out of food is no longer a problem. It feeds me with my mana.
Dragon Magic Points per level: 8
With this rune I can walk much faster. When I run normally, my speed doesn't change. However, when I sprint, I am immensely faster. This seems to consume mana though.
Dragon Magic Points per level: 4
This glyph creates breathable air for me. At level I I need mana for this, at level II it's completely free.
Dragon Magic Points per level: 2
This glyph made me feel like a dolphin in the water. Each level increases my speed in water immensely.
Dragon Magic Points per level: 2
This upgrade provides a limited Mist Form on Death.
If the user is an
Undead
Mist Form will be toggleable when cast as a spell and increasing its flight speed!
Dragon Magic Points per level: 8
A permanent, passive regeneration. A dream? No! A glyph!
Dragon Magic Points per level: 10
My Mana is running out. Anyway, I'll just take more! I get 250 Mana Points per Major Glyph. (100 with the Minor Glyph)
Minor: Dragon Magic Points per level: 4
Major: Dragon Magic Points per level: 5

Okay, maybe more mana isn't enough. Then this glyph might help me. Each level increases my mana regeneration.

Being part of the Undead faction, Mana Regeneration causes me to gain Souls just by hurting others.
Dragon Magic Points per level: 5
I'm wearing Dragon Mage Armor and I'm still afraid of dying? Okay, how about more lifes? Each level of the glyph gives me 2 extra hearts.
Dragon Magic Points per level: 2

Increases castet Spells Attributes:
- Magnitude +0.5
- Damage +3
- Duration: +30%.
Dragon Magic Points per level: 5
Makes you see damage and healing numbers.
Dragon Magic Points per level: 1
With this glyph I can jump higher per level while sprinting.
Dragon Magic Points per level: 2

Kaboom. Oh, TNT is just beautiful. And with the upgrade, I don't mind the explosion anymore either! But the environment is still not protected...

Anyways. TNT!
Dragon Magic Points per level: 4

With the Elytra you can become very fast... and can fly against the wall very fast. So that I don't mind that anymore, I developed this upgrade. It protects me from the elytra's kinetic damage and fall damage.
Dragon Magic Points per level: 4
With the upgrade, when I sprint, jump, and then sneak, I can crash onto the ground like a meteor and cause an explosion.
Dragon Magic Points per level: 3

Why are you hitting yourself with the arrow? Why are you hitting yourself with the arrow? Why are you hitting yourself with the arrow?

Oh yeah, my fault. I have a glyph for it.
Dragon Magic Points per level: 2
Oh man, the fires of hell are getting too annoying for me. With this rune, I can count on it tugging at a little bit of my mana instead of my life. With the Major Glyph it is completely free.
Minor: Dragon Magic Points per level: 4
Major: Dragon Magic Points per level: 2
The Elytra, a beautiful tool of the end. I'll just put them on my armor.
Dragon Magic Points per level: 5
I've always known that I'm above the others... That's how I can fly above them. Either quietly and slowly or at a breathtaking speed. (Elytra acceleration stops when I sneak)
Dragon Magic Points per level: 5
Increases the range in which the user can interact.
Dragon Magic Points per level: 8
A cut is pretty annoying. I should do something against it. With each level, all damage I receive is reduced by 20%.
Dragon Magic Points per level: 8
Hm, I mean spells are powerful. But a little more damage never hurts... at least not me.
Dragon Magic Points per level: 7

This shape allows me to curse other players from a distance, even if I can't see them.

If I hold a player charm in my hand and it is within range (Range Mod * 20), the charm will be destroyed, but the spell will hit the player.
However, to escape the curse, I can protect myself with an Amulet of Curse Protection.

With this shape I can target all my allies within the defined radius with my magic.

The animal companions are not forgotten either!
I need a Bracelet of Friendship to use this spell!
This is the magic I discovered after testing the strength of my ties with that person. For that reason now I call it "friendzone magic" I'm fine ... really good ...
This shape activates the spell where I placed my mark. To do this, I need a Rune of Marking in my offhand. The range is capped at 500 blocks, but I can increase that range with Magnitude.
When I use a Spell with this Shape and don't have a Rune of Marking in my off-Hand, I cast the spell in the location, saved by the mark spell.

Against some opponents it is better to stand in pairs.

This shape allows me to boost my allies and myself with my magic alike. When I'm sneaking, the spell targets me. Otherwise, it'll target the person (or block) I'm hitting.
I've learned to bend time to my will. With this spell, I can turn day into night.
This fey exclusive spell replenishes a small portion of my hunger.
I've learned to bend time to my will. With this spell, I can turn night into day.

I can focus my arcane magic on a Rune of Marking held in my hand to transport the spell's target to its marked location instantly. It can go about 1.000 blocks per magnitude, and might get them into trouble if the marked location is in a different dimension. In those cases, a Ritual of Return would be the better choice.
Instead of a Rune of Marking, I am also able to use a Player Charm.
When I use the Mark Spell and don't have a Rune of Marking in my hand, I teleport to the location I marked by the mark spell.
Should my enemies wear armor, I'll just let their armor crush them!
This spell deals physical damage to opponents, some of which can be absorbed by armor. In addition, the opponent is thrown back a bit, which can cause additional impact damage.
By increasing the Magnitude, the factor that the armor absorbs decreases more and more. At maximum strength, they take even more damage than if they were not wearing armor.
Lesser Magnitude increases the recoil the spell applies.
Water, the source of all life, and I can summon it whenever I need it.
I believe that with enough effort, I can even produce water despite infernal heat.
[This can be adjusted in the confings]
I can use my power to summon a small amount of the Infernal Lakes.
Maybe I'm not strong enough to wear all the effects on my Dragon Mage Armor all the time. But for a little while, I can channel that sheer-less power into my armor.
To use the spell, I need a Nether Star.
With this spell I can scribe the Rune of Marking. The place where the spell hits is marked in the rune.
When I hit a Player with the spell and have an Player Charm in my Offhand, the charm will be bound to the player. (Can be deactivated via Config)

If I don't have a Rune of Marking in my hand, I memorize its location and can reuse it for other spells. In each dimension I can remember exactly one position.

Compatible Spells: Alternative Recall or At Mark.
If I have too many Brimstone Charms and my broken chalk is bothering me, I might try the indestructible Brimstone Chalk.
This charm brings me back to my bed if I fall into the endless nothingness of the void.
I found a way to keep the small dimensional rift open longer. With this contraption I can now keep the Rift open in a stationary manner.
I can fuse this bracelet with a spell to use it using a keyboard shortcut
(default R - "DM&R: Use Bracelet of Spell Storing")

.

To open the bracelets inventar, press the gui key (default control), and right click with it.

There are 2 types of this bracelet:
-
Normal:

This bracelet requires mana like any other spell and provides a short cooldown.
-
Cooldown:
This version requires no mana, but has a significantly higher cooldown. The cooldown does not affect the normal spells.
This item does not support channeled spells!

The gods have looked down on me long enough! It's time for me to rise up and mess with them!

With this amulet I can fly through the air like one of her angels without having to take off my armor.

The power of the archdevils in my hands, more flexible than ever!

If my spell is of the
realm of fire then it will be transformed into pure hellfire

. All aspects of the spell will be increased. Be warned, hellfire is a force of destruction, and you may end up losing control of the power if you aren't careful.

Any fires the spell creates will also be hellfire, which spread more quickly and deal more damage to those inside them.

This staff can only be crafted by those who have allied themselves to the
Demons of the Nether

The gods have looked down on me long enough! It's time for me to rise up and mess with them!

If the user is an
Undead
Mist Form will be toggleable when cast as a spell and increasing its flight speed!
I baked a very sweet cake. I replaced some of the sugar with Vinteum Dust and now the cake seems to be infused with magical threads.
If I eat the cake, it uses a portion of my mana and regenerates. But I have to be careful! If I don't have enough mana, I'll probably eat the whole cake!
Wearing this bracelet will spare my allies if it would end up as collateral damage.
Using a
player charm

in the bracelet, I mark a player as my ally.

My animals and the animals of my allies will also be spared.

A mysterious powder that causes the cells of the plants to mutate. This allows plants to transform into one another.

The Wither Rose is a dead plant and cannot be created or mutated by the powder.
The Fey can also refine the powder even further, so it only produces Magical Flowers.
The Core of the End, The Essence of the Dragon, an Item of Immeasurable Power!
This item can be obtained by slaying the Titan of the End. The ender dragon!

With this amulet I make peace with the other factions. I don't have to worry about enemies running around or even raids.

But the peace is fragile. An attack from my side declares war!

Small damage, but at what cost?!

With this belt I take half the damage, but I also deal only half the damage!

A Major Attack, but at what cost?!

With this belt I deal double damage but also suffer double damage!

My magic has made me the powerful being that I am. My words make mountains collapse and my movements bring my opponents to their knees. But I don't have enough. Why should I still bow to the gods when I can be one myself?
With the
Ritual of the Dragon Mage Armor
I can upgrade my armor to a indestructible Dragon Mage Armor. This already offers a fairly high level of protection, but I can still improve it. With
Upgrade Glyphs
I can add some more abilities to the armor. All I have to do is fuse the glyph to my armor via the
Ritual of Upgrade

However, the amount of Dragon Magic that I can add to my armor is limited to 64. All installed glyphs combined cannot exceed the amount of Dragon Magic Points of the armor. However, there are also other containers I can channel my dragon magic into.

My glyphs aren't the only way I have to maximize my armor's potential. I can also fortify my armor with spells, which activate as soon as I take damage.

Container Gui Open Modifier-Key (Default: Control) and right click to open the menu

. One spell hits me, the other targets the person who attacked me.
While I have to put on full armor to use their effects, all runes seem to be installed only on the chestplate.
Magic has controlled me in many places, but I will no longer bow to it for its sake!
If a negative effect were to burden me, the crystal's mana would offset the obstacle and protect me from it. However, the amulet cannot protect me from effects that last too long.
In addition to negative effects, it also protects me from spells cast via the
Curse
Shape.
Another container to channel my dragon magic into with 32 slots. Correspondingly, like the Dragon Magic Armor, I can merge
glyphs
with the amulet, but I still have to wear the full
Dragon Mage Armor
Another container to channel my dragon magic into with 16 slots. Correspondingly, like the Dragon Magic Armor, I can merge
glyphs
with the amulet, but I still have to wear the full
Dragon Mage Armor
Additionally, each upgrade of this ring is enhanced by one unit.
Another container to channel my dragon magic into with 16 slots.
glyphs
with the amulet.
However, in order to obtain the effects, I don't have to wear Dragon Mage Armor.

sections.value: Ritual of the Dragon Mage Armor

json.text: With this ritual I can upgrade my faction armor to Dragon Mage Armor.
I must wear my full faction armor to perform this ritual. This is then fused with the power of the dragons and becomes the Dragon Mage armor. Enchantments are carried over.
It seems to me that I can only start the ritual if I have maxed out my magic skills. In other words, I have to be level 75 to use this ritual.
The power of my Dragon Mage Armor is not based on the almighty metal of the armor, but on the runes on it.

With this ritual I can add upgrade glyphs to my armor and other Dragon Magic Containers. Each glyph has a special ability that transfers to my armor. I can read about this on the relevant upgrade glyphs page.
Each Glyph has a maximum level at which it can be installed.
In addition, a glyph also has a cost, which is how much Dragon Magic it takes to increase the installed level by one.
I may be strong, but I'm not invincible. Perhaps I should prepare myself to be defeated one day, to rise from my ashes, to defeat those who killed me!
This ritual returns me to the spot where my former self was murdered.
Even if I'm lucky enough to find one of the untold relicts, it might not be the one I want.
With this ritual I can trade it with another relict.
My faction brought me to where I am today. But isn't my potential higher? Couldn't I reach more? Is my faction holding me back? Maybe I should free myself from this burden.
WARNING: With this ritual I free myself from my faction. But I'm also losing every step I've made since then!
